message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

past commits have removed hard coded font colors which is generally good. however now the text in the loading progress bar changes based on theme, i.e. a dark color in light theme and light color in dark theme. however because the progress bar color is the same in both themes the text color also should not change. can we revise the app so the loading progress bar font color is white like it was before? i suggest looking at the git history to study this first. ultrathink

content.thinking:
The user wants to understand an issue with the loading progress bar text color. They say that in past commits, hard coded font colors were removed, which is good, but now the text in the loading progress bar changes based on theme (dark color in light theme, light color in dark theme). However, the progress bar color stays the same in both themes, so they want the text color to stay consistent too - specifically white like it was before.

They suggest looking at the git history first to study this.

Since I'm in plan mode, I need to research this issue first, then present a plan for fixing it. Let me start by looking at the recent git history to understand what changes were made regarding colors and themes.

From the git status, I can see there are many modified files related to theming:
- themes.xml files (both regular and night versions)
- Various fragments
- Layout files

Let me start by examining the recent git history to understand the changes made to font colors.

content.text: I'll help you fix the loading progress bar font color issue. Let me start by examining the git history to understand what changes were made to font colors and themes.

input.description: View recent commit history to understand theme-related changes

content.content:
90c9264 fix(theme): Complete dark theme implementation with status bar and icon fixes
8c2febb refactor(theme): Improve theme infrastructure and consistency
030b7c8 fix(theme): Fix dark theme application for fragment backgrounds
cbdb6bc refine: Remove redundant light/dark theme choice selectors
8c614ac refine: Simplify themes by removing secondary Wiki themes
869f159 fix: Fix alpha timing issue during orientation changes
fe02ad6 fix: Resolve orientation change issues with fragment management
c3697a2 Clean up outdated logs
f8e684d Build: Correct .gitignore and add .gitattributes
a170078 Chore: Normalize line endings for cross-platform compatibility

content.thinking:
I see several recent commits related to theme changes. The most recent ones are "fix(theme): Complete dark theme implementation with status bar and icon fixes" and "refactor(theme): Improve theme infrastructure and consistency". And earlier we have "refine: Remove redundant light/dark theme choice selectors" and "refine: Simplify themes by removing secondary Wiki themes".

Let me look at the specific changes in those commits to understand what was changed regarding font colors.

input.description: Show files changed in commit that removed redundant theme selectors

content.content:
commit cbdb6bc1bcba84632f85349980d22bd04636114e
Author: Osamu Miyawaki <omiyawaki@icloud.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 6 10:48:08 2025 -0400

    refine: Remove redundant light/dark theme choice selectors
    
    Simplifies appearance settings by removing theme choice dropdowns that
    only had one option each, creating a cleaner single-setting interface.
    
    - Remove light/dark theme choice preferences from XML layouts
    - Simplify settings fragments to only handle app theme mode
    - Remove unused preference constants and theme choice logic
    - Directly use OSRS themes based on light/dark mode selection
    - Clean up unused string arrays and preference handling code

app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/OSRSWikiApp.kt
app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt
app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/Prefs.kt
app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/SettingsFragment.kt
app/src/main/res/values/arrays.xml
app/src/main/res/xml/preferences.xml
app/src/main/res/xml/preferences_appearance.xml

content.content:
commit cbdb6bc1bcba84632f85349980d22bd04636114e
Author: Osamu Miyawaki <omiyawaki@icloud.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 6 10:48:08 2025 -0400

    refine: Remove redundant light/dark theme choice selectors
    
    Simplifies appearance settings by removing theme choice dropdowns that
    only had one option each, creating a cleaner single-setting interface.
    
    - Remove light/dark theme choice preferences from XML layouts
    - Simplify settings fragments to only handle app theme mode
    - Remove unused preference constants and theme choice logic
    - Directly use OSRS themes based on light/dark mode selection
    - Clean up unused string arrays and preference handling code

diff --git a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/OSRSWikiApp.kt b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/OSRSWikiApp.kt
index acdb46a..3ef6f83 100644
--- a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/OSRSWikiApp.kt
+++ b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/OSRSWikiApp.kt
@@ -156,8 +156,7 @@ class OSRSWikiApp : Application() {
                 nightModeFlags == Configuration.UI_MODE_NIGHT_YES
             }
         }
-        val themeTag = if (isNightMode) Prefs.darkThemeChoice else Prefs.lightThemeChoice
-        return Theme.ofTag(themeTag) ?: Theme.DEFAULT_LIGHT
+        return if (isNightMode) Theme.OSRS_DARK else Theme.OSRS_LIGHT
     }
 
     private fun initializeNetworkCallback() {
diff --git a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt
index d2654ea..96c1c34 100644
--- a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt
+++ b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt
@@ -21,20 +21,9 @@ class AppearanceSettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
         setPreferencesFromResource(R.xml.preferences_appearance, rootKey)
 
         val appThemeModePref = findPreference<ListPreference>(Prefs.KEY_APP_THEME_MODE)
-        val lightThemeChoicePref = findPreference<Preference>(Prefs.KEY_LIGHT_THEME_CHOICE)
-        val darkThemeChoicePref = findPreference<Preference>(Prefs.KEY_DARK_THEME_CHOICE)
-
-        // Set the initial enabled state for the light/dark theme choices.
-        updateThemeChoiceStates(appThemeModePref?.value, lightThemeChoicePref, darkThemeChoicePref)
-
-        // A single listener for all theme-related preferences.
-        val themeChangeListener = Preference.OnPreferenceChangeListener { preference, newValue ->
-            // If the preference being changed is the main app theme mode,
-            // update the enabled state of the dependent preferences.
-            if (preference.key == Prefs.KEY_APP_THEME_MODE) {
-                updateThemeChoiceStates(newValue as? String, lightThemeChoicePref, darkThemeChoicePref)
-            }
 
+        // Theme change listener for app theme mode preference.
+        val themeChangeListener = Preference.OnPreferenceChangeListener { _, _ ->
             // Post the recreate call to the view's message queue. This ensures the
             // preference value has time to be persisted before the activity is destroyed,
             // and provides immediate visual feedback for the theme change.
@@ -46,10 +35,8 @@ class AppearanceSettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
             true
         }
 
-        // Assign the same listener to all three theme preferences.
+        // Assign the listener to the app theme mode preference.
         appThemeModePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        lightThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        darkThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
     }
 
     override fun onViewCreated(view: View, savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
@@ -96,29 +83,6 @@ class AppearanceSettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
         summary?.applyRubikUILabel()
     }
 
-    /**
-     * Enables or disables the light/dark theme choice preferences based on the app theme mode.
-     */
-    private fun updateThemeChoiceStates(
-        mode: String?,
-        lightPref: Preference?,
-        darkPref: Preference?
-    ) {
-        when (mode) {
-            "light" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = true
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = false
-            }
-            "dark" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = false
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true
-            }
-            "auto" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = true
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true
-            }
-        }
-    }
 
     companion object {
         const val TAG = "AppearanceSettingsFragment"
diff --git a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/Prefs.kt b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/Prefs.kt
index e4a8ff0..d176d7e 100644
--- a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/Prefs.kt
+++ b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/Prefs.kt
@@ -7,8 +7,6 @@ object Prefs {
     // String constants for preference keys, to be used by fragments and the data layer.
     // These keys MUST match the keys defined in res/xml/preferences.xml
     const val KEY_APP_THEME_MODE = "app_theme_mode"
-    const val KEY_LIGHT_THEME_CHOICE = "light_theme_choice"
-    const val KEY_DARK_THEME_CHOICE = "dark_theme_choice"
     const val KEY_DOWNLOAD_READING_LIST_ARTICLES = "downloadReadingListArticles"
     const val KEY_COLLAPSE_TABLES = "collapseTables"
     const val KEY_OFFLINE_CACHE_SIZE_LIMIT = "offlineCacheSizeLimit"
@@ -34,19 +32,6 @@ object Prefs {
     val appThemeMode
         get() = PrefsIoUtil.getString(KEY_APP_THEME_MODE, "auto") ?: "auto"
 
-    /**
-     * Gets the specific choice for the light theme.
-     * Defaults to "osrs_light".
-     */
-    val lightThemeChoice
-        get() = PrefsIoUtil.getString(KEY_LIGHT_THEME_CHOICE, "osrs_light") ?: "osrs_light"
-
-    /**
-     * Gets the specific choice for the dark theme.
-     * Defaults to "osrs_dark".
-     */
-    val darkThemeChoice
-        get() = PrefsIoUtil.getString(KEY_DARK_THEME_CHOICE, "osrs_dark") ?: "osrs_dark"
 
     /**
      * Gets the cache size limit in megabytes.
diff --git a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/SettingsFragment.kt b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/SettingsFragment.kt
index b46895f..933f584 100644
--- a/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/SettingsFragment.kt
+++ b/app/src/main/java/com/omiyawaki/osrswiki/settings/SettingsFragment.kt
@@ -18,20 +18,9 @@ class SettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
         setPreferencesFromResource(R.xml.preferences, rootKey)
 
         val appThemeModePref = findPreference<ListPreference>(Prefs.KEY_APP_THEME_MODE)
-        val lightThemeChoicePref = findPreference<Preference>(Prefs.KEY_LIGHT_THEME_CHOICE)
-        val darkThemeChoicePref = findPreference<Preference>(Prefs.KEY_DARK_THEME_CHOICE)
-
-        // Set the initial enabled state for the light/dark theme choices.
-        updateThemeChoiceStates(appThemeModePref?.value, lightThemeChoicePref, darkThemeChoicePref)
-
-        // A single listener for all theme-related preferences.
-        val themeChangeListener = Preference.OnPreferenceChangeListener { preference, newValue ->
-            // If the preference being changed is the main app theme mode,
-            // update the enabled state of the dependent preferences.
-            if (preference.key == Prefs.KEY_APP_THEME_MODE) {
-                updateThemeChoiceStates(newValue as? String, lightThemeChoicePref, darkThemeChoicePref)
-            }
 
+        // Theme change listener for app theme mode preference.
+        val themeChangeListener = Preference.OnPreferenceChangeListener { _, _ ->
             // Post the recreate call to the view's message queue. This ensures the
             // preference value has time to be persisted before the activity is destroyed,
             // and provides immediate visual feedback for the theme change.
@@ -43,10 +32,8 @@ class SettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
             true
         }
 
-        // Assign the same listener to all three theme preferences.
+        // Assign the listener to the app theme mode preference.
         appThemeModePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        lightThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        darkThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
     }
 
     override fun onViewCreated(view: View, savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
@@ -54,29 +41,6 @@ class SettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
         setupFonts()
     }
 
-    /**
-     * Enables or disables the light/dark theme choice preferences based on the app theme mode.
-     */
-    private fun updateThemeChoiceStates(
-        mode: String?,
-        lightPref: Preference?,
-        darkPref: Preference?
-    ) {
-        when (mode) {
-            "light" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = true
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = false
-            }
-            "dark" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = false
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true
-            }
-            "auto" -> {
-                lightPref?.isEnabled = true
-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true
-            }
-        }
-    }
 
     private fun setupFonts() {
         L.d("SettingsFragment: Setting up fonts...")
diff --git a/app/src/main/res/values/arrays.xml b/app/src/main/res/values/arrays.xml
index ee722b8..39c8602 100644
--- a/app/src/main/res/values/arrays.xml
+++ b/app/src/main/res/values/arrays.xml
@@ -12,21 +12,6 @@
         <item>auto</item>
     </string-array>
 
-    <!-- Light Theme Choice -->
-    <string-array name="light_theme_choice_entries">
-        <item>OSRS Light</item>
-    </string-array>

-            app:key="light_theme_choice"

-            app:defaultValue="osrs_light"

-

         <SwitchPreferenceCompat
             app:key="collapseTables"

             // Post the recreate call to the view's message queue. This ensures the
             // preference value has time to be persisted before the activity is destroyed,
             // and provides immediate visual feedback for the theme change.
@@ -43,10 +32,8 @@ class SettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
             true
         }
 
-        // Assign the same listener to all three theme preferences.
+        // Assign the listener to the app theme mode preference.
         appThemeModePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        lightThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
-        darkThemeChoicePref?.onPreferenceChangeListener = themeChangeListener
     }
 
     override fun onViewCreated(view: View, savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
@@ -54,29 +41,6 @@ class SettingsFragment : PreferenceFragmentCompat() {
         setupFonts()

-            "dark" -> {

-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true

-            "auto" -> {

-                darkPref?.isEnabled = true

-        }
-    }

         L.d("SettingsFragment: Setting up fonts...")

content.content:
commit 8c2febb8ffece9ff9ce6736ace9f5bacc2841a82
Author: Osamu Miyawaki <omiyawaki@icloud.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 6 12:32:47 2025 -0400

    refactor(theme): Improve theme infrastructure and consistency
    
    Additional theme improvements:
    - Add theme change notification system in BaseActivity and MainActivity
    - Make NewsFragment theme-aware for consistent theming
    - Fix status bar color to use dynamic theme attribute
    - Simplify night theme to properly inherit from OSRSDark theme
    - Update fragment_page.xml to use themed text color
    - Post theme change notifications after fragment restoration
    
    These changes ensure more robust theme switching across the entire app.

content.thinking:
Perfect! Here's exactly the issue. In commit 8c2febb, the loading text in fragment_page.xml was changed from:

```
android:textColor="@color/white"
```

to:

```
android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"
```

This is what's causing the loading progress bar text to change color based on theme - it's now using the theme's primary text color instead of being hardcoded to white.

Since the user mentioned that the progress bar color stays the same in both themes, and they want the text to remain white like it was before, I need to revert this specific change.

Let me also check if there are any other places where similar changes might have been made that could affect progress bars. Let me look at the current state of the file and see if there are other progress-related elements:

file.content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    tools:context=".page.PageFragment">

    <com.omiyawaki.osrswiki.views.ObservableWebView
        android:id="@+id/page_web_view"
        android:layout_width="0dp"
        android:layout_height="0dp"
        android:visibility="invisible"
        android:clipToPadding="false"
        android:paddingTop="?attr/actionBarSize"
        android:paddingBottom="@dimen/nav_bar_height"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
        tools:visibility="visible"/>

    <FrameLayout
        android:id="@+id/progress_container"
        android:layout_width="305dp"
        android:layout_height="35dp"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        tools:visibility="visible">

        <ProgressBar
            android:id="@+id/progressBar"
            style="?android:attr/progressBarStyleHorizontal"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="match_parent"
            android:indeterminate="false"
            android:max="100"
            android:progressDrawable="@drawable/osrs_progress_bar_custom"
            tools:progress="50" />

        <TextView
            android:id="@+id/progress_text"
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:layout_gravity="center"
            android:fontFamily="@font/runescape_plain"
            android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"
            android:textAppearance="@style/AppTextAppearance.Body"
            tools:text="Loading page..." />

    </FrameLayout>

    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/errorTextView"
        android:layout_width="0dp"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_marginStart="16dp"
        android:layout_marginEnd="16dp"
        android:gravity="center"
        android:padding="16dp"
        android:text="@string/label_error_loading_page"
        android:textAppearance="?attr/textAppearanceSubtitle1"
        android:textColor="?attr/colorError"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="@+id/page_web_view" />

    <com.omiyawaki.osrswiki.view.PageScrollerView
        android:id="@+id/page_scroller_view"
        android:layout_width="48dp"
        android:layout_height="48dp"
        android:layout_marginTop="?attr/actionBarSize"
        android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
        android:background="@drawable/shape_circle"
        android:elevation="5dp"
        android:scaleType="center"
        android:src="@drawable/ic_baseline_drag_handle_24"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:backgroundTint="?attr/colorPrimary"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
        app:tint="?attr/colorOnPrimary"
        tools:visibility="visible" />

</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>

This is causing the text color to change based on the theme. According to the git history, this used to be:


The user is correct that the progress bar itself (progressDrawable="@drawable/osrs_progress_bar_custom" at line 41) stays the same color in both themes, so the text should remain white for consistency.

input.description: Check if most recent theme commit modified fragment_page.xml

content.thinking:
Now I have a clear understanding of the issue. Based on my research:

## The Problem:
1. In commit `8c2febb` ("refactor(theme): Improve theme infrastructure and consistency"), the loading progress bar text in `fragment_page.xml` was changed from `android:textColor="@color/white"` to `android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"`

2. This change causes the progress bar text to now use the theme's primary text color, which means:
   - In light theme: dark text on the progress bar
   - In dark theme: light text on the progress bar

3. However, as the user mentioned, the progress bar itself (`@drawable/osrs_progress_bar_custom`) stays the same color in both themes, so having the text color change makes it inconsistent and potentially harder to read.

## The Solution:
The fix is simple - revert the progress text color back to white (`@color/white`) so it remains consistently white regardless of theme, just like it was before.

The specific change needed is in `/Users/miyawaki/Android/osrswiki/app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_page.xml` at line 50:

Change:
```xml
android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"
```

Back to:
```xml
android:textColor="@color/white"
```

This appears to be the only progress bar text affected by this change based on my search through the codebase.

Let me present the plan:

input.plan:
## Plan: Fix Loading Progress Bar Text Color

**Problem Identified:**
In commit `8c2febb`, the loading progress bar text in `fragment_page.xml` was changed from hardcoded white (`@color/white`) to theme-dependent (`?attr/primary_text_color`). This causes the text to be dark in light theme and light in dark theme, which is inconsistent since the progress bar background stays the same color in both themes.

**Solution:**
Revert the progress bar text color back to white for consistency across all themes.

**Changes needed:**
1. Edit `/app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_page.xml` line 50

toolUseResult.plan:
## Plan: Fix Loading Progress Bar Text Color

**Problem Identified:**
In commit `8c2febb`, the loading progress bar text in `fragment_page.xml` was changed from hardcoded white (`@color/white`) to theme-dependent (`?attr/primary_text_color`). This causes the text to be dark in light theme and light in dark theme, which is inconsistent since the progress bar background stays the same color in both themes.

**Solution:**
Revert the progress bar text color back to white for consistency across all themes.

**Changes needed:**
1. Edit `/app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_page.xml` line 50
2. Change `android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"` back to `android:textColor="@color/white"`

**Files to modify:**
- `app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_page.xml` (progress_text TextView at line 50)

This appears to be the only progress bar text affected by the theme changes based on the codebase search.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    tools:context=".page.PageFragment">

    <com.omiyawaki.osrswiki.views.ObservableWebView
        android:id="@+id/page_web_view"
        android:layout_width="0dp"
        android:layout_height="0dp"
        android:visibility="invisible"
        android:clipToPadding="false"
        android:paddingTop="?attr/actionBarSize"
        android:paddingBottom="@dimen/nav_bar_height"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
        tools:visibility="visible"/>

    <FrameLayout
        android:id="@+id/progress_container"
        android:layout_width="305dp"
        android:layout_height="35dp"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        tools:visibility="visible">

        <ProgressBar
            android:id="@+id/progressBar"
            style="?android:attr/progressBarStyleHorizontal"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="match_parent"
            android:indeterminate="false"
            android:max="100"
            android:progressDrawable="@drawable/osrs_progress_bar_custom"
            tools:progress="50" />

        <TextView
            android:id="@+id/progress_text"
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:layout_gravity="center"
            android:fontFamily="@font/runescape_plain"
            android:textColor="?attr/primary_text_color"
            android:textAppearance="@style/AppTextAppearance.Body"
            tools:text="Loading page..." />

    </FrameLayout>

    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/errorTextView"
        android:layout_width="0dp"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_marginStart="16dp"
        android:layout_marginEnd="16dp"
        android:gravity="center"
        android:padding="16dp"
        android:text="@string/label_error_loading_page"
        android:textAppearance="?attr/textAppearanceSubtitle1"
        android:textColor="?attr/colorError"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="@+id/page_web_view"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="@+id/page_web_view" />

    <com.omiyawaki.osrswiki.view.PageScrollerView
        android:id="@+id/page_scroller_view"
        android:layout_width="48dp"
        android:layout_height="48dp"
        android:layout_marginTop="?attr/actionBarSize"
        android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
        android:background="@drawable/shape_circle"
        android:elevation="5dp"
        android:scaleType="center"
        android:src="@drawable/ic_baseline_drag_handle_24"
        android:visibility="gone"
        app:backgroundTint="?attr/colorPrimary"
        app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
        app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
        app:tint="?attr/colorOnPrimary"
        tools:visibility="visible" />

</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>

all themes since the progress bar background color doesn't change.
This restores the original white color that was changed to theme-dependent
in the recent theme refactoring.
EOF
)"
